intro: Viracocha sigmoidea, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the cold, dry conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive shape, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Viracocha sigmoidea is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its traditional use in Andean cultures.
